intro: Echium divaricatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its showy flowers and medicinal properties. Echium divaricatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
